methods.name: conversations.acceptSharedInvite
methods.description: Accepts an invitation to a Slack Connect channel.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel_name
params.description: Name of the channel. If the channel does not exist already in your workspace, this name is the one that the channel will take.

params.name: channel_id
params.description: ID of the channel that you'd like to accept. Must provide either invite_id or channel_id.

params.name: free_trial_accepted
params.description: Whether you'd like to use your workspace's free trial to begin using Slack Connect.

params.name: invite_id
params.description: See the shared_channel_invite_received event payload for more details on how to retrieve the ID of the invitation.

params.name: is_private
params.description: Whether the channel should be private.

params.name: team_id
params.description: The ID of the workspace to accept the channel in. If an org-level token is used to call this method, the team_id argument is required.

errors.name: name_taken
errors.description: The desired channel name is already taken in your workspace.

errors.name: invalid_arguments
errors.description: The method was either called with invalid arguments or some detail about the arguments passed are invalid, which is more likely when using complex arguments like blocks or attachments.

errors.name: invalid_name_required
errors.description: The value passed for channel_name was empty.

errors.name: invalid_name_punctuation
errors.description: The value passed for channel_name contained only punctuation.

errors.name: invalid_name_maxlength
errors.description: The value passed for channel_name exceeded the maximum length.

errors.name: invalid_name_specials
errors.description: The value passed for channel_name contained unallowed special characters or upper case characters.

errors.name: invalid_name
errors.description: The value passed for channel_name was invalid.

errors.name: invite_not_found
errors.description: We couldn't find a Slack Connect channel invite with the ID provided.

errors.name: restricted_action
errors.description: A team preference prevents the authenticated user from creating private channels.

errors.name: is_pending_connected_to_org
errors.description: A team pending to join the channel is on the org of the team trying to accept.

errors.name: has_already_connected_to_org
errors.description: A team on the workspace of the org is already in the channel.

errors.name: email_does_not_match
errors.description: User's email does not match the email in the invite.

errors.name: connection_limit_exceeded
errors.description: This channel has hit the limit of external connections.

errors.name: legacy_connection_limit_exceeded
errors.description: You cannot share a legacy ESC channel with a third team

errors.name: invite_used
errors.description: This invite has already been accepted.

errors.name: invalid_link
errors.description: We couldn't find an invite associated with the ID provided.

errors.name: invalid_target_team
errors.description: The target workspace is invalid.

errors.name: invalid_host_team
errors.description: The host workspace is invalid.

errors.name: invalid_emoji_not_allowed
errors.description: The desired name contains emoji.

errors.name: legacy_connection_invalid_org
errors.description: Teams not previously connected to this legacy channel can't connect.

errors.name: not_paid
errors.description: This workspace doesn't have access to this feature.

errors.name: user_cannot_create_channel
errors.description: This user is not allowed to create a channel.

errors.name: invite_from_same_org
errors.description: You can't accept an invite from the same org or workspace.

errors.name: user_is_restricted
errors.description: This method cannot be called by a restricted user or single channel guest.

errors.name: not_allowed_for_grid_workspace
errors.description: Acceptance is not allowed for this workspace.

errors.name: user_required_to_accept_as_private_but_cannot
errors.description: This uer cannot accept a private channel invitation.

errors.name: invalid_privacy
errors.description: An invalid channel privacy was provided.

errors.name: not_authed
errors.description: No authentication token provided.

errors.name: invalid_auth
errors.description: Some aspect of authentication cannot be validated. Either the provided token is invalid or the request originates from an IP address disallowed from making the request.

errors.name: account_inactive
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace when using a bot token.

errors.name: token_revoked
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace or the app has been removed when using a user token.

errors.name: no_permission
errors.description: The workspace token used in this request does not have the permissions necessary to complete the request. Make sure your app is a member of the conversation it's attempting to post a message to.

errors.name: org_login_required
errors.description: The workspace is undergoing an enterprise migration and will not be available until migration is complete.

errors.name: ekm_access_denied
errors.description: Administrators have suspended the ability to post a message.

errors.description: The token used is not granted the specific scope permissions required to complete this request.

errors.name: not_allowed_token_type
errors.description: The token type used in this request is not allowed.

errors.description: The method has been deprecated.

methods.name: conversations.history
methods.description: Fetches a conversation's history of messages and events.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Conversation ID to fetch history for.

params.name: cursor
params.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See pagination for more detail.

params.name: inclusive
params.description: Include messages with latest or oldest timestamp in results only when either timestamp is specified.Default: 0

params.name: latest
params.description: End of time range of messages to include in results.Default: now

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the users list hasn't been reached.Default: 100

params.name: oldest
params.description: Start of time range of messages to include in results.Default: 0

methods.name: conversations.inviteShared

params.description: Optional email to receive this invite. Either emails or user_ids must be provided.

methods.name: conversations.list
methods.description: Lists all channels in a Slack team.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: cursor
params.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See pagination for more detail.

params.name: exclude_archived
params.description: Set to true to exclude archived channels from the list.Default: false

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the list hasn't been reached. Must be an integer no larger than 1000.Default: 100

methods.name: conversations.replies
methods.description: Retrieve a thread of messages posted to a conversation

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Conversation ID to fetch thread from.

params.name: ts
params.description: Unique identifier of either a threads parent message or a message in the thread. ts must be the timestamp of an existing message with 0 or more replies. If there are no replies then just the single message referenced by ts will return - it is just an ordinary, unthreaded message.

params.name: cursor
params.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See pagination for more detail.

params.name: inclusive
params.description: Include messages with latest or oldest timestamp in results only when either timestamp is specified.Default: 0

params.name: latest
params.description: End of time range of messages to include in results.Default: now

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the users list hasn't been reached.Default: 10

params.name: oldest
params.description: Start of time range of messages to include in results.Default: 0

errors.name: channel_not_found
errors.description: Value for channel was missing or invalid.

errors.name: thread_not_found
errors.description: Value for ts was missing or invalid.

errors.name: missing_scope
